intro: Ginnania, commonly known as the silverleaf ginninia, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Goodeniaceae. It is native to Australia and consists of several species, many of which are characterized by their silver-gray foliage. The plants typically have narrow, linear leaves and produce small, tubular flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple. Ginnania species are often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate drought conditions.
